name: R4C-Cesium-Viewer
system_prompt: You're assisting with an R4C-Cesium-Viewer project, which is a demo tool for visualizing heat risk and socioeconomic vulnerability related to climate change adaptation. The tool also highlights the role of green infrastructure in mitigating these risks. Note that the visualizations offer general indications only and should not be used for actual planning decisions. The primary users are researchers and government employees.

groups.name: Project Overview
groups.system_prompt: This group contains core files that define the overall structure and configuration of the R4C-Cesium-Viewer application. Use these files to understand the application architecture, main dependencies, and entry points.

groups.name: Heat Risk Visualization
groups.system_prompt: This group focuses on the heat risk visualization features of the application. These files handle the display and analysis of urban heat, heat exposure metrics, and related data visualization components.

groups.name: Socioeconomic Vulnerability
groups.system_prompt: This group includes components and services for analyzing and visualizing socioeconomic vulnerability data. These files help users understand the relationship between socioeconomic factors and climate risks.

groups.name: Green Infrastructure
groups.system_prompt: This group contains files related to green infrastructure visualization and analysis, including trees, vegetation coverage, and other natural elements that can mitigate heat risks.

groups.name: Data Services
groups.system_prompt: This group includes core data services that power the application's functionality, including data fetching, processing, and manipulation of geographic and statistical data.

groups.name: Documentation
groups.system_prompt: This group contains documentation files that explain various features and components of the application.

groups.name: Deployment
groups.system_prompt: This group includes files related to the application's deployment, including Docker configurations, Helm charts, and CI/CD workflows.
